column2: keyboard instrument that sounds by striking the strings with a hammer.
percussion instrument in which a thin membrane is stretched over a hollow frame and struck by hand or with a bachi to produce sound.
The strings are tuned to the perfect fifth degree and are struck with the bow to produce sound.
It is played by plucking or scratching down the strings with the fingers or a pick.
About 1/4 to 1/3 of its length is cylindrical and wound in an oblong shape.
It is classified as a repellent string instrument In Japanese
column3: it is included in a group of instruments called tategoto.
